Enrich a CWP dataset with missing labels and geometries

Source: R/enrich_dataset_if_needed.R
enrich_dataset_if_needed.Rd

This function enriches a dataset (data.frame or sf) by:

  • filling in missing descriptive labels (species, gear type, fleet, units, etc.),

  • attaching or validating geometries, using SQL queries, local fallback files, or online downloads.

Usage

enrich_dataset_if_needed(data, connectionDB = NULL, save_prefix = NULL)

Arguments

data

A data.frame or sf object following CWP standards.

connectionDB

Optional. A DBI-compatible database connection.

save_prefix

Optional. A prefix for saving output files (.qs and .csv).

Value

A list with two elements:

with_geom

An sf object enriched with geometry.

without_geom

A data.frame enriched without geometry.

Details

Steps performed:

  • Load required codelists (species, measurements, gear, fleet, etc.) via SQL or fallback.

  • Normalize units (e.g. “Tons” → “t”, “Number of fish” → “no”).

  • Left-join to add each *_label column alongside its code.

  • Reorder columns: base columns with their labels immediately after.

  • Convert to sf (CRS EPSG:4326).

  • Optionally save to disk if save_prefix is provided.

See also

st_as_sf, dbGetQuery

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
df <- data.frame(
  species = c("COD", "SAL"),
  measurement_unit = c("Tons", "Number of fish"),
  geographic_identifier = c("0001", "0002"),
  fishing_mode = "LL",
  fishing_fleet = "FleetA",
  measurement_type = "KT",
  measurement = "catch",
  measurement_processing_level = "raised",
  gear_type = "01.1"
)
result <- enrich_dataset_if_needed(df)
str(result)
} # }
